action.action-desc: Mrs. Houchin introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To authorize the exclusion of shareholder proposals from proxy or consent solicitation material if such proposals substantially implement, substantially duplicate, or are substantially similar to previously included proposals.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Expensive, Stifling Governance Act of 2023 or the No ESG Act of 2023.

subsection.text: A shareholder proposal submitted to an issuer pursuant to section 240.14a–8 of title 17, Code of Federal Regulations, may be excluded by an issuer from its proxy or consent solicitation material for a meeting of the shareholders of such issuer if the shareholder proposal—

paragraph.text: has been substantially implemented by the issuer by implementing policies, practices, or procedures that compare favorably with the guidelines of the proposal and address the proposal’s underlying concerns;
substantially duplicates by having the same principal thrust or principal focus as another proposal previously submitted to the issuer by another proponent that will be included in such material; or

addresses substantially the same subject matter as a previous proposal that shares the same substantive concerns as a proposal previously included in the proxy or consent solicitation material for a meeting of the shareholders of an issuer—

subparagraph.text: for a meeting of the shareholders conducted in the preceding 5 calendar years; and

clause.text: occurred in the preceding 3 calendar years; and

subclause.text: if voted on once during such 5-year period, received less than 10 percent of the votes cast;
if voted on twice during such 5-year period, received less than 20 percent of the votes cast; or
if voted on three or more times during such 5-year period, received less 40 percent of the votes cast.

subsection.text: The Securities and Exchange Commission may not finalize or apply the positions contained in the proposed rule entitled Substantial Implementation, Duplication, and Resubmission of Shareholder Proposals under Exchange Act Rule 14a–8 (87 Fed. Reg. 45052), issue any substantially similar rule, or apply any substantially similar rule, including with respect to a no-action or other interpretive request.
